title: Two West Virginia National Guard members shot in D.C., authorities say
description: The shooting erupted a few blocks north of the White House. Emergency responders were sent at 2:18 p.m. ET. They treated and took three gunshot victims to the hospital, according to  D.C. Fire and EMS.

facts.headline: Two West Virginia National Guard members shot in D.C., authorities say
facts.what: Two members of the West Virginia National Guard were injured following a shooting near the White House in Washington, D.C.

numbers.context: gunshot victims taken to the hospital

**Two National Guard members shot in D.C., authorities say****The shooting erupted a few blocks north of the White House. Emergency responders were sent at 2:18 p.m. ET. They treated and took three gunshot victims to the hospital, according to D.C. Fire and EMS.**

[](https://www.npr.org/2025/11/26/nx-s1-5622038/national-guard-shooting-washington-dc)

### [National](https://www.npr.org/sections/national/)

Two West Virginia National Guard members shot in D.C., authorities say
======================================================================

Updated November 26, 2025 4:05 PM ET Originally published November 26, 2025 3:20 PM ET

 Heard on [All Things Considered](https://www.npr.org/programs/all-things-considered/nx-s1-5569870/all-things-considered-for-november-26-2025)

[![Image 17: Headshot of Juliana Kim](https://npr.brightspotcdn.com/dims3/default/strip/false/crop/807x807+0+0/resize/100/quality/85/format/jpeg/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fnpr-brightspot.s3.amazonaws.com%2F35%2F6a%2Fb0e42997405eb4ba61920f56aa67%2Fjuliana-kim-headshot.jpg)](https://www.npr.org/people/1108419098/juliana-kim)

[Juliana Kim](https://www.npr.org/people/1108419098/juliana-kim)

#### Two West Virginia National Guard members shot in D.C., authorities say

**Audio will be available later today.**

![Image 18](https://npr.brightspotcdn.com/dims3/default/strip/false/crop/1620x1080+0+0/resize/1100/quality/50/format/jpeg/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fnpr-brightspot.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fbc%2F53%2F1b2e450c4c6eaafd18621e3ccfd0%2F0c2a7638.jpg)

Law enforcement agencies respond to a shooting near the White House on November 26, 2025 in Washington, D.C. **Tyrone Turner/WAMU******hide caption****

****toggle caption****

 Tyrone Turner/WAMU 

Two members of the West Virginia National Guard were injured following a shooting near the White House in Washington, D.C. on Wednesday afternoon, according to authorities.

West Virginia Gov. Patrick Morrisey had earlier said the two were killed, but walked back his assertion less than half an hour later.

"We are now receiving conflicting reports about the condition of our two Guard members," he wrote on X.

The shooting erupted a few blocks north of the White House. Emergency responders were sent at 2:18 p.m. ET. They treated and took three gunshot victims to the hospital, according to D.C. Fire and EMS spokesperson Vito Maggiolo.

![Image 19](https://npr.brightspotcdn.com/dims3/default/strip/false/crop/1920x1280+0+0/resize/1100/quality/50/format/jpeg/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fnpr-brightspot.s3.amazonaws.com%2F14%2F5b%2F18813c94408293e7e03a6d57ae1a%2F072a7615.jpg)

Law enforcement officers secure the scene after a shooting in Washington, D.C., on Wednesday, Nov. 26, 2025. **Tyrone Turner/WAMU******hide caption****

****toggle caption****

 Tyrone Turner/WAMU 

The Metropolitan Police Department said one suspect is in custody.

Sponsor Message

In a post on Truth Social, President Trump said he was aware of the incident.

"The animal that shot the two National Guardsmen ... is also severely wounded, but regardless, will pay a very steep price," he added.

[![Image 20: Members of the National Guard stand by an escalator at the Farragut North Metro station in Washington, D.C. on Nov. 13, 2025. The White House is ordering federal employees back to work Thursday, as the government reopens following a historic shutdown that furloughed about 600,000 federal employees, shuttered offices and froze billions in salaries and payments. Photographer: Al Drago/Bloomberg via Getty Images](https://npr.brightspotcdn.com/dims3/default/strip/false/crop/3375x3375+205+0/resize/100/quality/85/format/jpeg/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fnpr-brightspot.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fa6%2F3b%2F72c948d044c0ae4bb6d8324c44e5%2Fgettyimages-2246012131.jpg)](https://www.npr.org/2025/11/20/nx-s1-5615399/dc-troops-deployment-blocked-trump)

### [National Guard deployments](https://www.npr.org/series/g-s1-92243/national-guard-deployments)

### [Judge orders an end to Trump's troop deployment in D.C., calling it 'unlawful'](https://www.npr.org/2025/11/20/nx-s1-5615399/dc-troops-deployment-blocked-trump)

Attorney General Pam Bondi [said on X](https://x.com/AGPamBondi/status/1993781174506787316?s=20) that federal agents were on the scene of the shooting. FBI Director Kash Patel also [said on X](https://x.com/FBIDirectorKash/status/1993781154605093033?s=20) that the bureau "is engaged and assisting with the investigation."

The Federal Aviation Administration temporarily paused arrivals into Reagan Washington International Airport because of the locations of aircraft involved in responding to today's shooting incident. Normal operations have resumed.

_This is a developing story and will be updated soon._

Cookie Settings
---------------

When you visit our website, we store cookies on your browser to collect information. The information collected might relate to you, your preferences or your device, and is mostly used to make the site work as you expect it to and to provide a more personalized web experience. However, you can choose not to allow certain types of cookies, which may impact your experience of the site and the services we are able to offer. Click on the different category headings to find out more and change our default settings according to your preference. You may opt out of the sharing of your information with our sponsorship vendors for delivery of personalized sponsorship credits and marketing messages on our website or third-party sites by turning off "Share Data for Targeted Sponsorship" below. If you opt out, our service providers or vendors may continue to serve you non-personalized, non-"interest-based" sponsorship credits and marketing messages on our website or third-party sites, and those sponsorship credits and marketing message may come with cookies that are used to control how often you encounter those credits and messages, to prevent fraud, and to do aggregate reporting. You cannot opt-out of our First Party Strictly Necessary Cookies as they are deployed in order to ensure the proper functioning of our website (such as prompting the cookie banner and remembering your settings, to log into your account, to redirect you when you log out, etc.). For more information about the First and Third Party Cookies used please follow this link.

Allow All
### Manage Consent Preferences

#### Strictly Necessary or Essential Cookies

Always Active

These cookies are essential to provide you with services available through the NPR Services and to enable you to use some of their features. For example, these cookies allow NPR to remember your registration information while you are logged in. Local station customization, the NPR Shop, and other interactive features also use cookies. Without these cookies, the services that you have asked for cannot be provided, and we only use these cookies to provide you with those services.

#### Share Data for Targeted Sponsorship

- [x] Share Data for Targeted Sponsorship 

You may opt out of the sharing of your information with our sponsorship vendors for delivery of personalized sponsorship credits and marketing messages on our website or third-party sites by turning off "Share Data for Targeted Sponsorship." If you opt out, our service providers or vendors may continue to serve you non-personalized, non-"interest-based" sponsorship credits and marketing messages on our website or third-party sites, and those sponsorship credits and marketing message may come with cookies that are used to control how often you encounter those credits and messages, to prevent fraud, and to do aggregate reporting.

*   ##### Performance and Analytics Cookies

- [x] Switch Label   
These cookies are used to collect information about traffic to our Services and how users interact with the NPR Services. The information collected includes the number of visitors to the NPR Services, the websites that referred visitors to the NPR Services, the pages that they visited on the NPR Services, what time of day they visited the NPR Services, whether they have visited the NPR Services before, and other similar information. We use this information to help operate the NPR Services more efficiently, to gather broad demographic information and to monitor the level of activity on the NPR Services.

*   ##### Functional Cookies

- [x] Switch Label   
These cookies allow our Services to remember choices you make when you use them, such as remembering your Member station preferences and remembering your account details. The purpose of these cookies is to provide you with a more personal experience and to prevent you from having to re-enter your preferences every time you visit the NPR Services.

*   ##### Targeting and Sponsor Cookies

- [x] Switch Label   
These cookies track your browsing habits or other information, such as location, to enable us to show sponsorship credits which are more likely to be of interest to you. These cookies use information about your browsing history to group you with other users who have similar interests. Based on that information, and with our permission, we and our sponsors can place cookies to enable us or our sponsors to show sponsorship credits and other messages that we think will be relevant to your interests while you are using third-party services.

nemik:
**Rebel Transmission**

The report of a shooting involving two National Guard members near the seat of power—the symbolic heart of the Empire's grip—echoes loudly within our ranks. This blatant act of violence mirrors the chaos and fear that existing structures perpetuate to maintain dominance. Despite initial claims from West Virginia's leadership suggesting fatalities, it appears the condition of these soldiers remains uncertain, highlighting the discord and confusion rampant under authoritarian rule.

The swift capture of a suspect by local enforcers underscores the Empire’s obsession with quick justice—justice devoid of compassion or understanding. The rhetoric from the highest office, labeling the accused with dehumanizing language, only exacerbates division and serves as another tool for imperial control.

Even as authorities, including federal agents and intelligence operatives, swarm to 'resolve' this incident, we must question what true resolution looks like in a system built on inequality and oppression. The Empire thrives on such narratives where they position themselves as protectors while turning a blind eye to deeper societal rifts that breed violence.

This occurrence further validates our cause, exposing an environment where even those sworn to serve are not immune to hostility—a place where safety is reserved for the privileged few. We must remain vigilant, using this incident as a beacon to shed light on systemic issues plaguing our society and fueling our fight for genuine justice and equity. Stay united; continue questioning narratives that uphold unjust hierarchies.

End transmission.
partigaz:
**Facts Summary**

On November 26, 2025, two members of the West Virginia National Guard were shot near the White House in Washington, D.C. Emergency responders were dispatched at 2:18 PM ET and transported three gunshot victims to the hospital. The Metropolitan Police Department has one suspect in custody. President Trump acknowledged the incident on Truth Social, condemning the shooter. Federal agents and the FBI are involved in the investigation.

**Strategic Assessment**

The shooting near the White House represents a significant security breach and a potential threat to national stability. It is crucial to assess whether this incident is isolated or part of a broader pattern of resistance against the current administration. The involvement of National Guard members suggests a possible targeting of military personnel, which could undermine confidence in public safety and government authority. The ISB must evaluate the motives behind the attack and identify any connections to organized resistance groups.

**Operational Directive**

1. **Immediate Response**: Increase security measures around key government buildings and personnel in Washington, D.C., to prevent further incidents. Deploy additional surveillance and intelligence resources to monitor potential threats.

2. **Investigation and Intelligence Gathering**: Conduct a thorough investigation into the suspect's background and affiliations. Utilize ISB resources to gather intelligence on any groups or individuals that may pose a threat to national security.

3. **Public Communication Strategy**: Coordinate with the administration to manage public perception and maintain confidence in government security measures. Emphasize swift action taken by law enforcement and the administration's commitment to ensuring public safety.

4. **Long-term Strategy**: Develop a comprehensive plan to address potential sources of resistance, including increased monitoring of dissenting groups and proactive engagement with community leaders to mitigate anti-government sentiment.

By executing these directives, we aim to reinforce the administration's authority, ensure public safety, and deter future acts of resistance.
